Part 1 of 2I saw a job opening for a Corporate Events Manager that pays \displaystyle\${62},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{32} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{50} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 62,000 per year into dollars per hour.
If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${62000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${62000}}}{\text{year}}\times
1 year/50 weeks
1 week / 50 years
50 weeks/1 year
50 years/1 week
\displaystyle\times
1 week/32 hours
32 weeks/1 hour
32 hours/1 week
1 hour/32 weeks
Part 2 of 2 Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?
Hourly pay = dollars/hour
myopenmath.solution:
A: 1 year/50 weeks
A: 1 week/32 hours
38.75
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 62000 dollars
1 year = 50 weeks
1 week = 32 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 62,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${62000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{50}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{32}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${62000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{50}\cdot{32}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \approx{38.75}\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays \displaystyle{38.75} dollars/hour.
